properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 12 at 8:21PM EST until February 16 at 7:01PM EST by NWS Columbia SC
properties.description:
...River Flood Advisory Continues for Congaree River at Columbia...

.The Congaree River at Columbia will continue to gradually fall.
Although additional rainfall is forecast for Thursday, it will
not initiate any new sharp rises on the river. However, it will
likely prolong the current nuisance flooding along the West
Columbia and Cayce Riverwalk area. Rainfall amounts are expected
to be around one quarter of an inch or less.

The Flood Advisory Continues for the Congaree River at Columbia.
* Through Sunday.
* At 8 PM Wednesday the stage was 12.2 feet.
* Advisory stage is 10 feet.
* Flood stage is 19 feet.
* Forecast...The river at Columbia will fluctuate between 11 and
15 feet during the rest of the week.
* At 14 feet...Roads in low lying areas and swampland downstream
from Columbia become flooded. Most of the Cayce and West Columbia
river walk is flooded.
properties.instruction:
A Flood Advisory means that nuisance flooding may occur nearest the
river when the level is below the official flood stage.
